intro: Amblyorhinum phylicoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and fleshy. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Amblyorhinum phylicoides is often found in sandy soils and is a component of native grassland and shrubland ecosystems.
